content: I was looking at docs#Eq.subst and found out that the information link about equality leads to "Page not found". It seems that _ in TPIL URLs was replaced by - and that there is no .html anymore, so this page is now https://lean-lang.org/theorem_proving_in_lean4/quantifiers-and-equality/ and every reference to TPIL now leads to nothing.
I guess this raises the question of whether the old URLs should be restored, to fix broken links elsewhere in university courses or zulip threads
If this is possible then it seems to be the most practical solution. A redirection from old URLs to new ones could also solve this quite transparently.

Also while we are at it, something weird happened to permalinks for subtitles:

The full URL used by docs#Eq.subst is actually https://lean-lang.org/theorem_proving_in_lean4/quantifiers_and_equality.html#equality, replacing underscores and stripping .html gives https://lean-lang.org/theorem_proving_in_lean4/quantifiers-and-equality/#equality which does not point to the desired title "4.2. Equality". Using the outline on the left I can obtain the very long https://lean-lang.org/theorem_proving_in_lean4/Quantifiers-and-Equality/#Theorem-Proving-in-Lean-4--Quantifiers-and-Equality--Equality instead.

However for title 4.3. everything seems to be fine. The outline gives https://lean-lang.org/theorem_proving_in_lean4/Quantifiers-and-Equality/#calculational-proofs which corresponds to the old https://lean-lang.org/theorem_proving_in_lean4/quantifiers_and_equality.html#calculational-proofs that I found on the page How to use calc.

(sorry, the long URLs make the message a bit difficult to read)

Redirects are installed and tested.

The longer IDs are essentially internal implementation details. There's a way to add the old IDs manually, I'll do that too

David Thrane Christiansen said:

Redirects are installed and tested.

Are you sure you fully set them up? My initial example still leads me to "Page not found".
There was an issue with ordering of rules. They're working well here now, and so are the IDs - thanks!
Anthony Fernandes has marked this topic as resolved.
